name: src/drawer.js
Drawer
description: Parent class for renderers

params.name: container
params.description: The container node of the wavesurfer instance

params.name: params
params.description: The wavesurfer initialisation options

name: width
description: The width of the renderer

name: height
description: The height of the renderer

name: wrapper
description: The `<wave>` element which is added to the container

description: Alias of `util.style`

params.name: el
params.description: The element that the styles will be applied to

params.name: styles
params.description: The map of propName: attribute, both are used as-is

name: createWrapper
description:
Create the wrapper `<wave>` element, style it and set up the events for
interaction

name: handleEvent
description: Handle click event

params.name: e
params.description: Click event

params.name: noPrevent
params.description: Set to true to not call `e.preventDefault()`

name: drawPeaks
description: Draw peaks on the canvas

params.name: peaks
params.description:
Can also be an array of arrays for split channel
rendering

params.name: length
params.description: The width of the area that should be drawn

params.name: start
params.description:
The x-offset of the beginning of the area that
should be rendered

params.name: end
params.description:
The x-offset of the end of the area that should be
rendered

name: resetScroll
description: Scroll to the beginning

name: recenter
description: Recenter the viewport at a certain percent of the waveform

params.name: percent
params.description: Value from 0 to 1 on the waveform

name: recenterOnPosition
description:
Recenter the viewport on a position, either scroll there immediately or
in steps of 5 pixels

params.name: position
params.description: X-offset in pixels

params.name: immediate
params.description: Set to true to immediately scroll somewhere

name: getScrollX
description: Get the current scroll position in pixels

name: getWidth
description: Get the width of the container

name: setWidth
description: Set the width of the container

name: setHeight
description: Set the height of the container

name: progress
description: Called by wavesurfer when progress should be renderered

params.name: progress
params.description: From 0 to 1

name: destroy
description: This is called when wavesurfer is destroyed

name: updateCursor
description: Called after cursor related params have changed.

name: updateSize
description: Called when the size of the container changes so the renderer can adjust

name: drawBars
description: Draw a waveform with bars

params.description:
Can also be an array of arrays for split channel
rendering

params.name: channelIndex
params.description:
The index of the current channel. Normally
should be 0

params.name: start
params.description:
The x-offset of the beginning of the area that
should be rendered

params.name: end
params.description:
The x-offset of the end of the area that should be
rendered

params.description:
Can also be an array of arrays for split channel
rendering

params.description:
The index of the current channel. Normally

params.name: start
params.description:
The x-offset of the beginning of the area that
should be rendered

params.name: end
params.description:
The x-offset of the end of the area that should be
rendered

name: src/html-init.js

properties.name: defaults
properties.description: The default wavesurfer initialisation parameters

Selector or NodeList of
elements to attach instances to

properties.description:
URL

properties.name: loadPlugin
properties.description:
If set overwrites the default ajax function,
can be used to inject plugins differently.

name: Init
description:
The HTML initialisation API is not part of the main library bundle file and
must be additionally included.

The API attaches wavesurfer instances to all `<wavesurfer>` (can be
customised), parsing their `data-` attributes to construct an options object
for initialisation. Among other things it can dynamically load plugin code.

The automatic initialisation can be prevented by setting the
`window.WS_StopAutoInit` flag to true. The `html-init[.min].js` file exports
the `Init` class, which can be called manually.

Site-wide defaults can be added by setting `window.WS_InitOptions`.

name: constructor
description:
Instantiate Init class and initialise elements

This is done automatically if `window` is defined and
`window.WS_StopAutoInit` is not set to true

params.name: WaveSurfer
params.description: The WaveSurfer library object

params.name: params
params.description: initialisation options

name: WaveSurfer
description: cache WaveSurfer

name: containers
description: The nodes that should have instances attached to them

name: instances
description: An array of wavesurfer instances

name: initAllEls
description: Initialise all container elements

name: initEl
description: Initialise a single container element and add to `this.instances`

params.name: el
params.description: The container to instantiate wavesurfer to

params.name: plugins
params.description: An Array of plugin names to initialise with

Private method called by both load (from url)
and loadElt (existing media element).

params.description: HTML5 Audio or Video element

params.name: peaks
params.description: Array of peak data

description: Used by `wavesurfer.isPlaying()` and `wavesurfer.playPause()`

description: Used by `wavesurfer.getDuration()`

description:
Returns the current time in seconds relative to the audioclip's
duration.

name: getPlayedPercents
description: Get the position from 0 to 1

description: Get the audio source playback rate.

name: setPlaybackRate
description: Set the audio source playback rate.

description: Used by `wavesurfer.seekTo()`

params.description: Position to start at in seconds

description: Plays the loaded audio region.

params.name: start
params.description:
Start offset in seconds, relative to the beginning
of a clip.

params.name: end
params.description: When to stop, relative to the beginning of a clip.

name: pause
description: Pauses the loaded audio.

name: getPeaks
description:
Compute the max and min value of the waveform when broken into
<length> subranges.

params.name: length
params.description: How many subranges to break the waveform into.

params.name: first
params.description: First sample in the required range.

params.name: last
params.description: Last sample in the required range.

return.description:
Array of 2*<length> peaks or array of
arrays of peaks consisting of (max, min) values for each subrange.

name: setSinkId
description: Set the sink id for the media player

params.name: deviceId
params.description: String value representing audio device id.

name: getVolume
description: Get the current volume

return.description: value A floating point value between 0 and 1.

name: setVolume
description: Set the audio volume

params.name: value
params.description: A floating point value between 0 and 1.

name: destroy
description: This is called when wavesurfer is destroyed

name: src/peakcache.js
PeakCache
description:
Caches the decoded peaks data to improve rendering speed for lage audio

Is used if the option parameter `partialRender` is set to `true`

name: constructor
description: Instantiate cache

name: clearPeakCache
description: Empty the cache

name: peakCacheRanges
description:
Flat array with entries that are always in pairs to mark the
beginning and end of each subrange.  This is a convenience so we can
iterate over the pairs for easy set difference operations.

name: peakCacheLength
description:
Length of the entire cachable region, used for resetting the cache
when this changes (zoom events, for instance).

name: addRangeToPeakCache
description: Add a range of peaks to the cache

params.name: length
params.description: The length of the range

params.name: start
params.description: The x offset of the start of the range

params.name: end
params.description: The x offset of the end of the range

name: getCacheRanges
description: For testing

name: src/plugin/microphone.js

properties.name: constraints
properties.description:
The constraints parameter is a
MediaStreamConstaints object with two members: video and audio, describing
the media types requested. Either or both must be specified.

properties.name: bufferSize
properties.description:
The buffer size in units of sample-frames.
If specified, the bufferSize must be one of the following values: `256`,
`512`, `1024`, `2048`, `4096`, `8192`, `16384`

properties.name: numberOfInputChannels
properties.description:
Integer specifying the number of
channels for this node's input. Values of up to 32 are supported.

properties.name: deferInit
properties.description:
Set to true to manually call
`initPlugin('microphone')`

name: MicrophonePlugin
description: Visualise microphone input in a wavesurfer instance.

Microphone plugin definition factory

Allow user to select audio input device, eg. microphone, and

name: togglePlay
description: Pause/resume visualization.

description: Play visualization.

name: pause

(Single) Region plugin class

Enable creating regions by dragging wih

name: RegionsPlugin
description:
Regions are visual overlays on waveform that can be used to play and loop
portions of audio. Regions can be dragged and resized.

Visual customization is possible via CSS (using the selectors
`.wavesurfer-region` and `.wavesurfer-handle`).

name: create
description:
Regions plugin definition factory

This function must be used to create a plugin definition which can be
used by wavesurfer to correctly instantiate the plugin.

params.name: params
params.description: parameters use to initialise the plugin

name: src/plugin/spectrogram.js
FFT
description: Calculate FFT - Based on https://github.com/corbanbrook/dsp.js

properties.name: container
properties.description:
Selector of element or element in
which to render

properties.name: fftSamples
properties.description:
number of samples to fetch to FFT. Must be
a pwer of 2.

properties.name: noverlap
properties.description:
Size of the overlapping window. Must be <
fftSamples. Auto deduced from canvas size by default.

properties.name: windowFunc
properties.description:
The window function to be used. One of
these: `'bartlett'`, `'bartlettHann'`, `'blackman'`, `'cosine'`, `'gauss'`,
`'hamming'`, `'hann'`, `'lanczoz'`, `'rectangular'`, `'triangular'`

properties.name: alpha
properties.description:
Some window functions have this extra value.
(Between 0 and 1)

properties.name: pixelRatio
properties.description:
to control the
size of the spectrogram in relation with its canvas. 1 = Draw on the whole
canvas. 2 = Draw on a quarter (1/2 the length and 1/2 the width)

properties.name: deferInit
properties.description:
Set to true to manually call
`initPlugin('spectrogram')`

name: SpectrogramPlugin
description: Render a spectrogram visualisation of the audio.

name: create
description:
Spectrogram plugin definition factory

This function must be used to create a plugin definition which can be
used by wavesurfer to correctly instantiate the plugin.

params.name: params
params.description: parameters use to initialise the plugin

You probably want to use TimelinePlugin.create()

description:
This event handler has to be in the constructor function because it
relies on the debounce function which is only available after
instantiation

Use a debounced function if zoomDebounce is defined

name: destroy

Make sure the correct of timeline canvas elements exist and are cached in

name: renderCanvases

description: Set the canvas fill style

description: Set the canvas font

name: fillRect

Draw a rectangle on the canvases

(it figures out the offset for each canvas)

description: Fill a given text on the canvases

params.description: The element that the styles will be applied to

params.name: styles
params.description: The map of propName: attribute, both are used as-is

name: src/wavesurfer.js

properties.name: audioContext
properties.description:
Use your own previously
initialized AudioContext or leave blank.

properties.name: audioRate
properties.description:
Speed at which to play audio. Lower number is
slower.

properties.name: audioScriptProcessor
properties.description:
Use your own previously
initialized ScriptProcessorNode or leave blank.

properties.name: autoCenter
properties.description:
If a scrollbar is present, center the
waveform around the progress

properties.name: backend
properties.description:
`'WebAudio'|'MediaElement'` In most cases
you don't have to set this manually. MediaElement is a fallback for
unsupported browsers.

properties.name: barHeight
properties.description: The height of the wave

properties.name: barGap
properties.description:
The optional spacing between bars of the wave,
if not provided will be calculated in legacy format.

properties.name: closeAudioContext
properties.description:
Close and nullify all audio
contexts when the destroy method is called.

properties.name: container
properties.description:
CSS selector or HTML element where
the waveform should be drawn. This is the only required parameter.

properties.name: cursorColor
properties.description:
The fill color of the cursor indicating
the playhead position.

properties.name: cursorWidth
properties.description: Measured in pixels.

properties.name: fillParent
properties.description:
Whether to fill the entire container or
draw only according to `minPxPerSec`.

properties.name: forceDecode
properties.description:
Force decoding of audio using web audio
when zooming to get a more detailed waveform.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
The height of the waveform. Measured in
pixels.

properties.name: hideScrollbar
properties.description:
Whether to hide the horizontal
scrollbar when one would normally be shown.

properties.name: interact
properties.description:
Whether the mouse interaction will be
enabled at initialization. You can switch this parameter at any time later
on.

properties.name: loopSelection
properties.description:
(Use with regions plugin) Enable
looping of selected regions

properties.name: maxCanvasWidth
properties.description:
Maximum width of a single canvas in
pixels, excluding a small overlap (2 * `pixelRatio`, rounded up to the next
even integer). If the waveform is longer than this value, additional canvases
will be used to render the waveform, which is useful for very large waveforms
that may be too wide for browsers to draw on a single canvas.

properties.name: mediaControls
properties.description:
(Use with backend `MediaElement`)
this enables the native controls for the media element

properties.name: mediaType
properties.description:
(Use with backend `MediaElement`)
`'audio'|'video'`

properties.name: minPxPerSec
properties.description:
Minimum number of pixels per second of
audio.

properties.name: normalize
properties.description:
If true, normalize by the maximum peak
instead of 1.0.

properties.name: partialRender
properties.description:
Use the PeakCache to improve
rendering speed of large waveforms

properties.name: pixelRatio
properties.description:
The pixel ratio used to
calculate display

properties.name: plugins
properties.description:
An array of plugin definitions to
register during instantiation, they will be directly initialised unless they
are added with the `deferInit` property set to true.

properties.name: progressColor
properties.description:
The fill color of the part of the
waveform behind the cursor.

properties.name: removeMediaElementOnDestroy
properties.description:
Set to false to keep the
media element in the DOM when the player is destroyed. This is useful when
reusing an existing media element via the `loadMediaElement` method.

properties.name: renderer
properties.description:
Can be used to inject a custom
renderer.

properties.name: responsive
properties.description:
If set to `true` resize the
waveform, when the window is resized. This is debounced with a `100ms`
timeout by default. If this parameter is a number it represents that timeout.

properties.name: scrollParent
properties.description:
Whether to scroll the container with a
lengthy waveform. Otherwise the waveform is shrunk to the container width
(see fillParent).

properties.name: skipLength
properties.description:
Number of seconds to skip with the
skipForward() and skipBackward() methods.

properties.name: splitChannels
properties.description:
Render with seperate waveforms for
the channels of the audio

properties.name: waveColor
properties.description:
The fill color of the waveform after the
cursor.

properties.name: xhr
properties.description: XHR options.

name: PluginDefinition
description: The Object used to describe a plugin

properties.name: name
properties.description:
The name of the plugin, the plugin instance will be
added as a property to the wavesurfer instance under this name

properties.name: staticProps
properties.description:
The properties that should be added to the
wavesurfer instance as static properties

properties.name: deferInit
properties.description:
Don't initialise plugin
automatically

properties.name: params
properties.description:
The plugin parameters, they are the first parameter
passed to the plugin class constructor function

properties.name: instance
properties.description:
The plugin instance factory, is called with
the dependency specified in extends. Returns the plugin class.

name: PluginClass
description:
This is the interface which is implemented by all plugin classes. Note
that this only turns into an observer after being passed through
`wavesurfer.addPlugin`.

name: create
description:
Plugin definition factory

This function must be used to create a plugin definition which can be
used by wavesurfer to correctly instantiate the plugin.

params.name: params
params.description: The plugin params (specific to the plugin)

name: constructor
description: Construct the plugin

params.name: ws
params.description: The wavesurfer instance

params.name: params
params.description: The plugin params (specific to the plugin)

name: init
description:
Initialise the plugin

Start doing something. This is called by
`wavesurfer.initPlugin(pluginName)`

name: destroy
description:
Destroy the plugin instance

Stop doing something. This is called by
`wavesurfer.destroyPlugin(pluginName)`

name: WaveSurfer
description: WaveSurfer core library class

name: create
description: Instantiate this class, call its `init` function and returns it

name: VERSION
description:
The library version number is available as a static property of the
WaveSurfer class

name: util
description:
Functions in the `util` property are available as a prototype property to
all instances

name: util
description:
Functions in the `util` property are available as a static property of the
WaveSurfer class

name: constructor
description: Initialise wavesurfer instance

params.name: params
params.description: Instantiation options for wavesurfer

name: params
description: Extract relevant parameters (or defaults)

name: init
description: Initialise the wave

name: registerPlugins
description:
Add and initialise array of plugins (if `plugin.deferInit` is falsey),
this function is called in the init function of wavesurfer

params.name: plugins
params.description: An array of plugin definitions

emits.description: Called with the array of plugin definitions

name: addPlugin
description: Add a plugin object to wavesurfer

params.name: plugin
params.description: A plugin definition

emits.description: Called with the name of the plugin that was added

name: [pluginStaticProp]
description:
Properties defined in a plugin definition's `staticProps` property are added as
staticProps properties of the WaveSurfer instance

name: [plugin.name]
description:
Instantiated plugin classes are added as a property of the wavesurfer
instance

name: initPlugin
description: Initialise a plugin

params.name: name
params.description: A plugin name

name: destroyPlugin
description: Destroy a plugin

params.name: name
params.description: A plugin name

name: destroyAllPlugins
description:
Destroy all initialised plugins. Convenience function to use when
wavesurfer is removed

name: createDrawer
description: Create the drawer and draw the waveform

name: createBackend
description: Create the backend

name: createPeakCache
description: Create the peak cache

name: getDuration
description: Get the duration of the audio clip

name: getCurrentTime
description: Get the current playback position

name: setCurrentTime
description: Set the current play time in seconds.

params.name: seconds
params.description:
A positive number in seconds. E.g. 10 means 10
seconds, 60 means 1 minute

name: play
description:
Starts playback from the current position. Optional start and end
measured in seconds can be used to set the range of audio to play.

params.name: start
params.description: Position to start at

params.name: end
params.description: Position to end at

name: pause
description: Stops playback

name: playPause
description: Toggle playback

name: isPlaying
description: Get the current playback state

return.description: False if paused, true if playing

name: skipBackward
description: Skip backward

params.name: seconds
params.description:
Amount to skip back, if not specified `skipLength`
is used

name: skipForward
description: Skip forward

params.name: seconds
params.description:
Amount to skip back, if not specified `skipLength`
is used

name: skip
description:
Skip a number of seconds from the current position (use a negative value
to go backwards).

params.name: offset
params.description: Amount to skip back or forwards

name: seekAndCenter
description: Seeks to a position and centers the view
examples:
// seek and go to the middle of the audio
wavesurfer.seekTo(0.5);

params.name: progress
params.description: Between 0 (=beginning) and 1 (=end)

name: seekTo
description: Seeks to a position
examples:
// seek to the middle of the audio
wavesurfer.seekTo(0.5);

params.name: progress
params.description: Between 0 (=beginning) and 1 (=end)

name: stop
description: Stops and goes to the beginning.

name: setSinkId
description: Set the playback volume.

params.name: deviceId
params.description: String value representing underlying output device

name: setVolume
description: Set the playback volume.

params.name: newVolume
params.description:
A value between 0 and 1, 0 being no
volume and 1 being full volume.

name: getVolume
description: Get the playback volume.

return.description:
A value between 0 and 1, 0 being no
volume and 1 being full volume.

name: setPlaybackRate
description: Set the playback rate.

params.name: rate
params.description:
A positive number. E.g. 0.5 means half the normal
speed, 2 means double speed and so on.

name: getPlaybackRate
description: Get the playback rate.

name: toggleMute
description:
Toggle the volume on and off. It not currenly muted it will save the
current volume value and turn the volume off. If currently muted then it
will restore the volume to the saved value, and then rest the saved
value.

name: setMute
description: Enable or disable muted audio

name: getMute
description: Get the current mute status.

name: isReady
description: Get the current ready status.

name: getFilters
description:
Get the list of current set filters as an array.

Filters must be set with setFilters method first

name: toggleScroll
description: Toggles `scrollParent` and redraws

name: toggleInteraction
description: Toggle mouse interaction

name: getWaveColor
description: Get the fill color of the waveform after the cursor.

name: setWaveColor
description: Set the fill color of the waveform after the cursor.

params.name: color
params.description: A CSS color string.

name: getProgressColor
description: Get the fill color of the waveform behind the cursor.

name: setProgressColor
description: Set the fill color of the waveform behind the cursor.

params.name: color
params.description: A CSS color string.

name: getCursorColor
description:
Get the fill color of the cursor indicating the playhead
position.

name: setCursorColor
description:
Set the fill color of the cursor indicating the playhead
position.

params.name: color
params.description: A CSS color string.

name: getHeight
description: Get the height of the waveform.

name: setHeight
description: Set the height of the waveform.

params.name: height
params.description: Height measured in pixels.

name: drawBuffer
description: Get the correct peaks for current wave viewport and render wave

name: zoom
description:
Horizontally zooms the waveform in and out. It also changes the parameter
`minPxPerSec` and enables the `scrollParent` option. Calling the function
with a falsey parameter will reset the zoom state.

params.name: pxPerSec
params.description:
Number of horizontal pixels per second of
audio, if none is set the waveform returns to unzoomed state

name: loadArrayBuffer
description: Decode buffer and load

name: loadDecodedBuffer
description: Directly load an externally decoded AudioBuffer

name: loadBlob
description: Loads audio data from a Blob or File object

params.name: blob
params.description: Audio data

name: load
description: Loads audio and re-renders the waveform.

params.name: url
params.description:
The url of the audio file or the
audio element with the audio

params.name: peaks
params.description:
Wavesurfer does not have to decode
the audio to render the waveform if this is specified

params.name: preload
params.description:
(Use with backend `MediaElement`)
`'none'|'metadata'|'auto'` Preload attribute for the media element

params.name: duration
params.description:
The duration of the audio. This is used to
render the peaks data in the correct size for the audio duration (as
befits the current minPxPerSec and zoom value) without having to decode
the audio.

name: loadBuffer
description: Loads audio using Web Audio buffer backend.

name: loadMediaElement
description: Either create a media element, or load an existing media element.

params.name: urlOrElt
params.description:
Either a path to a media file, or an
existing HTML5 Audio/Video Element

params.name: peaks
params.description:
Array of peaks. Required to bypass web audio
dependency

params.name: preload
params.description:
Set to true if the preload attribute of the
audio element should be enabled

name: decodeArrayBuffer
description: Decode an array buffer and pass data to a callback

name: getArrayBuffer
description: Load an array buffer by ajax and pass to a callback

name: onProgress
description: Called while the audio file is loading

name: exportPCM
description: Exports PCM data into a JSON array and opens in a new window.
todo: Update exportPCM to work with new getPeaks signature

params.name: length
params.description: The scale in which to export the peaks. (Integer)

params.name: accuracy
params.description: (Integer)

params.name: noWindow
params.description:
Set to true to disable opening a new
window with the JSON

name: exportImage
description:
Save waveform image as data URI.

The default format is `image/png`. Other supported types are
`image/jpeg` and `image/webp`.

name: cancelAjax
description: Cancel any ajax request currently in progress

name: empty
description: Display empty waveform.

name: destroy
description: Remove events, elements and disconnect WebAudio nodes.

name: src/webaudio.js
WebAudio
description: WebAudio backend

name: supportsWebAudio
description: Does the browser support this backend

name: getAudioContext
description: Get the audio context used by this backend or create one

name: getOfflineAudioContext
description: Get the offline audio context used by this backend or create one

name: constructor
description: Construct the backend

name: init
description: Initialise the backend, called in `wavesurfer.createBackend()`

name: setFilter
description: Unpacked `setFilters()`

name: setFilters
description: Insert custom Web Audio nodes into the graph

params.name: filters
params.description: Packed filters array

name: createVolumeNode
description: Create the gain node needed to control the playback volume.

name: setSinkId
description: Set the sink id for the media player

params.name: deviceId
params.description: String value representing audio device id.

name: setVolume
description: Set the audio volume

params.name: value
params.description: A floating point value between 0 and 1.

name: getVolume
description: Get the current volume

return.description: value A floating point value between 0 and 1.

name: setPeaks
description: Set pre-decoded peaks

name: setLength
description: Set the rendered length (different from the length of the audio).

name: getPeaks
description: Compute the max and min value of the waveform when broken into <length> subranges.

params.name: length
params.description: How many subranges to break the waveform into.

params.name: first
params.description: First sample in the required range.

params.name: last
params.description: Last sample in the required range.

return.description:
Array of 2*<length> peaks or array of arrays of
peaks consisting of (max, min) values for each subrange.

name: getPlayedPercents
description: Get the position from 0 to 1

name: destroy
description: This is called when wavesurfer is destroyed

name: load
description: Loaded a decoded audio buffer

name: isPaused
description: Used by `wavesurfer.isPlaying()` and `wavesurfer.playPause()`

name: getDuration
description: Used by `wavesurfer.getDuration()`

name: seekTo
description: Used by `wavesurfer.seekTo()`

params.name: start
params.description: Position to start at in seconds

params.name: end
params.description: Position to end at in seconds

name: getPlayedTime
description: Get the playback position in seconds

name: play
description: Plays the loaded audio region.

params.name: start
params.description:
Start offset in seconds, relative to the beginning
of a clip.

params.name: end
params.description: When to stop relative to the beginning of a clip.

name: pause
description: Pauses the loaded audio.

name: getCurrentTime
description:
Returns the current time in seconds relative to the audioclip's
duration.

name: getPlaybackRate
description: Returns the current playback rate. (0=no playback, 1=normal playback)

name: setPlaybackRate
description: Set the audio source playback rate.

name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "wavesurfer.js",
  "version": "2.0.6",
  "description": "Interactive navigable audio visualization using Web Audio and Canvas",
  "main": "dist/wavesurfer.min.js",
  "directories": {
    "example": "example"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "start": "npm run build:plugins && npm run build:htmlinit && webpack-dev-server --config ./build-config/webpack.dev.main.js",
    "start:htmlinit": "npm run build:main && npm run build:plugins && webpack-dev-server --config ./build-config/webpack.dev.htmlinit.js",
    "start:plugins": "npm run build:main && npm run build:htmlinit && webpack-dev-server --config ./build-config/webpack.dev.plugins.js",
    "build": "npm run build:normal && npm run build:minified",
    "build:main": "webpack --config ./build-config/webpack.prod.main.js",
    "build:main:min": "webpack --config ./build-config/webpack.prod.main.min.js",
    "build:plugins": "webpack --config ./build-config/webpack.prod.plugins.js",
    "build:plugins:min": "webpack --config ./build-config/webpack.prod.plugins.min.js",
    "build:htmlinit": "webpack --config ./build-config/webpack.prod.htmlinit.js",
    "build:htmlinit:min": "webpack --config ./build-config/webpack.prod.htmlinit.min.js",
    "build:normal": "npm run build:main && npm run build:plugins && npm run build:htmlinit",
    "build:minified": "npm run build:main:min && npm run build:plugins:min && npm run build:htmlinit:min",
    "format": "prettier 'src/**/*.js*' 'example/**/*.js*' 'spec/**/*.js*' 'website/**/*.js*' 'build-config/**/*.js' karma.conf.js --write",
    "lint": "npm run lint:js && npm run lint:html",
    "lint:js": "eslint src example spec",
    "lint:html": "htmlhint example",
    "lint-and-format-staged": "lint-staged",
    "doc": "esdoc",
    "test": "karma start karma.conf.js",
    "prepublishOnly": "not-in-install && npm run build || in-install"
  },
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git://github.com/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js.git"
  },
  "author": "",
  "license": "BSD-3-Clause",
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js/issues"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "babel-core": "^6.26.3",
    "babel-eslint": "^8.2.6",
    "babel-loader": "^7.1.5",
    "babel-plugin-add-module-exports": "^0.2.1",
    "babel-plugin-istanbul": "^4.1.6",
    "babel-plugin-transform-class-properties": "^6.24.1",
    "babel-preset-env": "^1.7.0",
    "babel-register": "^6.26.0",
    "debounce": "^1.2.0",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-accessor-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-brand-plugin": "^1.0.1",
    "esdoc-coverage-plugin": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-integrate-test-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^5.4.0",
    "eslint-config-prettier": "^3.0.1",
    "eslint-loader": "^2.1.0",
    "eslint-plugin-prettier": "^2.6.2",
    "htmlhint": "^0.9.13",
    "in-publish": "^2.0.0",
    "jasmine-core": "^3.2.1",
    "karma": "^3.0.0",
    "karma-chrome-launcher": "2.2.0",
    "karma-coverage": "^1.1.2",
    "karma-coveralls": "^2.0.0",
    "karma-firefox-launcher": "^1.1.0",
    "karma-jasmine": "1.1.2",
    "karma-jasmine-matchers": "3.8.3",
    "karma-verbose-reporter": "0.0.6",
    "karma-webpack": "^4.0.0-beta.0",
    "lint-staged": "^7.2.2",
    "load-script": "^1.0.0",
    "pre-commit": "^1.2.2",
    "prettier": "^1.14.2",
    "uglifyjs-webpack-plugin": "^1.3.0",
    "webpack": "^4.16.5",
    "webpack-cli": "^3.1.0",
    "webpack-dev-server": "3",
    "webpack-merge": "^4.1.4"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/katspaugh/wavesurfer.js",
  "pre-commit": "lint-and-format-staged",
  "lint-staged": {
    "*.js": [
      "prettier",
      "eslint"
    ],
    "*.html": [
      "htmlhint"
    ]
  }
}
name: package.json
spec/peakcache.spec.js
describe0
description: PeakCache:

name: it1
description: empty cache returns full range

name: it2
description: different length clears cache

name: it3
description: consecutive calls return no ranges

name: it4
description: sliding window returns window sized range

name: it5
description: disjoint set creates two ranges

name: it6
description: filling in disjoint sets coalesces

name: it7
description: filling in disjoint sets coalesces / edge cases

name: spec/plugin-api.spec.js

description: WaveSurfer/plugin API:

name: it9
description: addPlugin adds staticProps and correctly builds and instantiates plugin class

name: it10
description: initPlugin calls init function of the plugin and adds its name to the initialisedPluginList

name: it11
description: destroyPlugin calls plugin destroy function and removes the plugin name from the initialisedPluginList

name: it12
description: registerPlugin adds a plugin but does not call plugin init function if the plugin property deferInit is truethy

name: it13
description: registerPlugin adds a plugin ands calls plugin init function if the plugin property deferInit is falsey

name: it18

description: util:

name: it20
description: extend extends an object shallowly with others

name: it21
